The hackeRnews package is an R wrapper for the Hacker News API. Project for Advanced R classes at the Warsaw University of Technology.

## Installation

You can install the development version from [GitHub](https://github.com/) with:

``` r
# install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("szymanskir/hackeRnews")
```

## Examples

### Word cloud

Get recent words used in job stories title to build awesome word cloud. See what's trending right now!

```r{echo=T}
library(hackeRnews)
library(tidyverse, dplyr)
library(tidytext, dplyr)
library(wordcloud)

job_stories <- hackeRnews::get_latest_job_stories()

# get titles, normalize used words, remove non alphabet characters
title_words <- unlist(
  lapply(job_stories, FUN=function(job_story) { job_story$title }) %>% 
  str_replace_all('[^A-Z|a-z]', ' ') %>% 
  str_to_upper() %>% 
  str_replace_all('\\s\\s*', ' ') %>% 
  str_split(' ')
)

# remove stop words
data('stop_words')
df <- data.frame(word=title_words, stringsAsFactors=FALSE) %>% 
  filter(!str_to_lower(word) %in% stop_words$word) %>% 
  count(word) %>% top_n(50, n)

#plot cloud word
ggplot(df, aes(label=word, size=n)) + 
  geom_text_wordcloud() + 
  scale_size_area(max_size = 15)


```
